title.value: Automatic Segmentation of the Spinal Cord Nerve Rootlets
title.justification: The title explicitly states the main focus and methodology of the paper, which is the automation of segmentation of spinal cord nerve rootlets.
title.quote: Automatic Segmentation of the Spinal Cord Nerve Rootlets

extractions.description: This paper presents a deep learning-based approach for the semantic segmentation of spinal cord nerve rootlets from T2-weighted MRI scans, utilizing a 3D convolutional neural network trained via active learning on open-access datasets. The method achieves a reasonable performance metric and is integrated into the Spinal Cord Toolbox (SCT) v6.2 or higher.

type.justification: The paper involves empirical testing of the segmentation model on different datasets and compares performance metrics, indicating it is empirical rather than theoretical.
type.quote: The method was tested on 3T T2-weighted images from datasets unseen during training to assess inter-site, inter-session, and inter-resolution variability.

name.justification: The research focuses on the analysis of medical images specifically for segmenting spinal cord nerve rootlets from MRI scans, which is a typical application within medical image analysis.
name.quote: The goal of this study was to develop an automatic method for the semantic segmentation of spinal nerve rootlets from T2-weighted magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) scans.

name.justification: The study employs deep learning methodologies like 3D convolutional neural networks for model training.
name.quote: A 3D multi-class convolutional neural network using an active learning approach to segment C2-C8 dorsal nerve rootlets.

name.justification: The study involves segmenting visual data from MRI scans, which falls under computer vision tasks.
name.quote: Semantic segmentation of spinal nerve rootlets from T2-weighted magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) scans.

name.justification: The nnUNetv2 framework was explicitly used for training the segmentation model as described in the study.
name.quote: The rootlets segmentation model was trained using nnUNetv2 (Isensee et al., 2021), a popular self-configuring deep learning-based framework.

is_contributed.justification: The model architecture (nnUNetv2) is not introduced as a new model but is used as a basis for the presented segmentation task.
is_contributed.quote: The rootlets segmentation model was trained using nnUNetv2 (Isensee et al., 2021), a popular self-configuring deep learning-based framework.

is_executed.justification: The model is executed as described in the context of the segmentation tasks and performance evaluation in the study.
is_executed.quote: The model was trained with a batch size of 2 using the stochastic gradient descent optimizer with a polynomial learning rate scheduler.

is_compared.justification: The study involves performance testing and comparison against different datasets and setups to gauge the effectiveness of the segmentation model.
is_compared.quote: Test Dice score was computed between the ground truth (GT) STAPLE segmentation and the segmentation obtained using the developed segmentation model (nnUNet).

referenced_paper_title.value: nnU-Net: a self-configuring method for deep learning-based biomedical image segmentation
referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the paper referenced for the model architecture used in this study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The rootlets segmentation model was trained using nnUNetv2 (Isensee et al., 2021), a popular self-configuring deep learning-based framework.

name.justification: Used for training the segmentation models, specifically mentioned with its data characteristics.
name.quote: Two open-access datasets were used for model training: OpenNeuro ds004507 (https://openneuro.org/datasets/ds004507/versions/1.0.1, multi-subject dataset n=10)...

referenced_paper_title.value: Pontomedullary junction as a reference for spinal cord cross-sectional area: validation across neck positions
referenced_paper_title.justification: The dataset is mentioned with reference to its application within the study rather than a standalone dataset publication.

name.justification: Used in the study as one of the main datasets to evaluate the segmentation model performance.

referenced_paper_title.value: Open-access quantitative MRI data of the spinal cord and reproducibility across participants, sites and manufacturers
referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the related referenced paper when discussing the spine-generic dataset.

name.justification: Used as a secondary testing dataset to assess model performance across sessions.
name.quote: The second testing dataset (test-set-2) is the Courtois-NeuroMod dataset ... an open-access dataset of healthy subjects scanned at regular intervals ...

referenced_paper_title.value: Longitudinal stability of brain and spinal cord quantitative MRI measures
referenced_paper_title.justification: Referenced paper related to the Courtois-NeuroMod dataset.

name.justification: Used to demonstrate the rootlet labeling in a widely recognized anatomical template.
name.quote: The developed segmentation model was applied to the PAM50 T2-weighted spinal cord template image to obtain dorsal nerve rootlets ...

referenced_paper_title.value: PAM50: Unbiased multimodal template of the brainstem and spinal cord aligned with the ICBM152 space
referenced_paper_title.justification: Referenced paper which introduced the PAM50 template used in this study.

name.justification: FSLeyes was used for the manual segmentation of images in the dataset.
name.quote: First, we manually segmented spinal cord dorsal nerve rootlets using FSLeyes image viewer ...

referenced_paper_title.value: Simultaneous truth and performance level estimation (STAPLE): an algorithm for the validation of image segmentation
referenced_paper_title.justification: FSLeyes is part of the FSL suite, referenced indirectly via general tools used for segmentation and analysis in combination with other methods.

name.justification: The Spinal Cord Toolbox (SCT) is mentioned as part of the software infrastructure that implements the developed segmentation method.
name.quote: The proposed methodology is open-source and readily available in the Spinal Cord Toolbox (SCT) v6.2 and higher.

referenced_paper_title.value: SCT: Spinal Cord Toolbox, an open-source software for processing spinal cord MRI data
referenced_paper_title.justification: This paper is referenced regarding the Spinal Cord Toolbox, showing its contribution and usage within this study.
